thread.title: Organize Your Data With CD/DVD Duplication
thread.title_full: Organize Your Data With CD/DVD Duplication

title: Organize Your Data With CD/DVD Duplication
text:
Basic PLUS Author | 36 Articles Joined: September 25, 2014 Organize Your Data With CD/DVD Duplication By Paul Nandrajog   31, 2015 
A few years back, many analysts were of the view that DVDs were on their deathbed. Many arguments were put forth against this medium of storage, but today it has grown in stature as the more reliable option. 
The Ideal Storage Medium 
If you are looking to store, package or distribute your content, then you must have come across the term DVD duplication frequently. It is thus important to understand the process entailed and also some pertinent issues around it even before hitting the market to look for a professional to help you out. 
Duplication in the simplest terms is similar to burning a CD/DVD on your personal computer from a master disc. For instance, if you are a videographer and you have an order for two wedding DVDs, you can easily do it from your PC. However, this is where these similarities end because DVD duplication involves burning multiple discs at the same time on sophisticated interconnected towers. 
If you have a corporate function coming up in two days and you need to hand out a packaged presentation to guests in the form of discs, a DVD is the ideal data storage medium. This professional process is best done by experts in their own studio using state-of-the-art equipment. This is simultaneously done in towers with hundreds of trays thus speeding up the entire project. 
Organizing Your Information 
While there are many storage media alternatives out there, none comes close to duplication in terms of organizing content. You can save company data on one disc with over 4.7GB of data to avoid multiple cabinets overflowing with files. More importantly, you don't have to retain hundreds of folders on your company computers as one backup disc can carry all the content. 
The process thus saves you space, which again translates to cost-savings. More importantly, you can easily access data saved on such media as opposed to scouring through hard drives for specific folders, and this enhances productivity. With backup information on such discs, you are also assured of more safety if any technical or natural disasters hit your premises. 
But these are not the only benefits of DVD duplication in the modern business setup. Take a look at some more. 
1. Guaranteed quality: Unlike other tools of storage, this process just recreates what is on the master DVD CD to others without any compromise on quality, sound and other features. 
2. Speed factor: If you need 1,000 copies of your product launched in two days, there is no better way to get it done than using this ingenious technology. Standard turn-time is about two to three days for even 5,000 units and this is downright impressive. 
3. Amazing printing and packaging: If you want to impress, this is the way to go because digital color printing is available to create awesome looking disks and sleeves. 
Well, you have two options here: sit down and make an arduous printed book for your guests or simply create a DVD, which is cheap, fast and more presentable. The choice is obvious and you should not look back.
